00023 complex double* initcmat(int n)
00024 {
00025   int i;
00026   complex double* A;
00027 
00028   A = (complex double*) malloc(n*n*sizeof(complex double));
00029   for (i=0; i<n*n; i++)
00030     A[i] = 0.0;
00031 
00032   return A;
00033 }
00034 
00035 
00036 void copycmat(int n, const complex double* A, complex double* B)
00037 {
00038   int i;
00039 
00040   for (i=0; i<n*n; i++)
00041     B[i] = A[i];
00042 }
00043 
00044 
00045 void mirrorcmat(int n, complex double* A)
00046 {
00047   int i,j;
00048 
00049   for (j=0; j<n; j++)
00050     for (i=0; i<j; i++)
00051       A[j+i*n] = conj(A[i+j*n]);
00052 }
00053 
00054 
00055 void hermitizecmat(int n, complex double* A)
00056 {
00057   int i,j;
00058   complex double alower, aupper;
00059 
00060   for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00061     for (j=0; j<=i; j++) {
00062       aupper = A[i+n*j];
00063       alower = A[j+n*i];
00064       A[i+n*j] = 0.5*(aupper+conj(alower));
00065       A[j+n*i] = 0.5*(alower+conj(aupper));
00066     }
00067 }
00068 
00069 
00070 void multcmat(const complex double* A, const complex double* B,
00071               complex double* C, int n)
00072 {
00073   int k,l,m;
00074 
00075   for (l=0; l<n; l++)
00076     for (k=0; k<n; k++) {
00077       C[l*n+k] = 0.0;
00078       for (m=0; m<n; m++)
00079         C[l*n+k] += A[m*n+k]*B[l*n+m];
00080     }
00081 }

00084 #define BUFSIZE 4096
00085 void freadivec(FILE* fp, int n, int* v)
00086 {
00087   int k;
00088   char buf[BUFSIZE];
00089   char* c;
00090 
00091   fgets(buf, BUFSIZE, fp);
00092   
00093   c=strtok(buf, " ");
00094   for (k=0; k<n; k++) {
00095     v[k]=atoi(c);
00096     c=strtok(NULL, " ");
00097   }
00098 }

00101 void fprintcvec(FILE* fp, int n, const complex double* V)
00102 {
00103   int i;
00104 
00105   for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00106     fprintf(fp, "(%15.8e,%15.8e) ", creal(V[i]), cimag(V[i]));
00107   fprintf(fp, "\n");
00108 }

00117 #define BUFSIZE 655536
00118 void freadcvec(FILE* fp, int n, complex double* a)
00119 {
00120   int l;
00121   char buf[BUFSIZE];
00122   char *c;
00123   double ref, imf;
00124 
00125   fgets(buf, BUFSIZE, fp);
00126 
00127   c = strtok(buf, " ,()");
00128   for (l=0; l<n; l++) {
00129     ref=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00130     imf=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00131     a[l] = ref + I*imf;
00132   }
00133 }

00158   char buf[BUFSIZE];
00159   char *c;
00160   double ref, imf;
00161

00164     c = strtok(buf, " ,()");

00166       ref=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00167       imf=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00168       A[k+l*n] = ref + I*imf;
00169     }
00170   }

00174 // matrix is transposed !
00175 void fprintcmatcols(FILE* fp, int n, int cols, const complex double* A)
00176 {

00178 
00179   for (i=0; i<cols; i++) {
00180     for (j=0; j<n; j++)
00181       fprintf(fp, "(%15.8e,%15.8e) ", creal(A[j+i*n]), cimag(A[j+i*n]));
00182     fprintf(fp, "\n");
00183   }

00188 #define BUFSIZE 655536
00189 void freadcmatcols(FILE* fp, int n, int cols, complex double* A)
00190 {
00191   int k, l;
00192   char buf[BUFSIZE];
00193   char *c;
00194   double ref, imf;
00195 
00196   for (k=0; k<cols; k++) {
00197     fgets(buf, BUFSIZE, fp);
00198     c = strtok(buf, " ,()");
00199     for (l=0; l<n; l++) {
00200       ref=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00201       imf=atof(c); c=strtok(NULL, " ,()");
00202       A[l+k*n] = ref + I*imf;
00203     }
00204   }

00207 
00208 void pseudoinverse(const complex double* A, complex double* B,
00209                    int n, double thresh)
00210 {
00211   const char jobu='O', jobvt='A';
00212 
00213   complex double *U = malloc(n*n*sizeof(complex double));
00214   complex double *Vh = malloc(n*n*sizeof(complex double));
00215   double* S = malloc(n*sizeof(double));
00216 
00217   const int lwork=5*n;
00218   complex double* work = malloc(lwork*sizeof(complex double));
00219   double* rwork = malloc(lwork*sizeof(double));
00220 
00221   int info;
00222   
00223   copycmat(n, A, U);
00224   FORTRAN(zgesvd)(&jobu, &jobvt, &n, &n, U, &n, S, 
00225                   NULL, &n, Vh, &n, work, &lwork, rwork, &info);
00226 
00227   int k,l,m;
00228 
00229   for (l=0; l<n; l++)
00230     for (k=0; k<n; k++) {
00231       B[k+l*n] = 0.0;
00232       m=0; 
00233       while (m<n && S[m]/S[0] > thresh) {
00234         B[k+l*n] += conj(Vh[m+k*n])*1/S[m]*conj(U[l+m*n]);
00235         m++;
00236       } 
00237     }
00238 
00239   free(Vh); free(U); free(S);
00240   free(work); free(rwork);
00241 }
00242 
00243 
00244 void eigensystem(complex double* A,
00245                  complex double* a, complex double* V, int n)
00246 {
00247   const char jobvl='N', jobvr='V';
00248 
00249   const int lwork=5*n;
00250   complex double* work = malloc(lwork*sizeof(complex double));
00251   double* rwork = malloc(2*n*sizeof(double));
00252   int info;
00253   
00254   FORTRAN(zgeev)(&jobvl, &jobvr, &n, A, &n, a, NULL, &n, V, &n,
00255                  work, &lwork, rwork, &info);
00256   if (info) {
00257     fprintf(stderr, "eigensystem: zgeev returned with error code: %d\n", info);
00258   }
00259 
00260   free(work); free(rwork);
00261 }

00263 
00264 void generalizedeigensystem(complex double* A, complex double* N, int n,
00265                             double thresh,
00266                             complex double* v, complex double* V, int* dim)
00267 {
00268   const char jobu='O', jobvt='A';
00269 
00270   complex double* U = malloc(n*n*sizeof(complex double));
00271   complex double* Vh = malloc(n*n*sizeof(complex double));
00272   double* S = malloc(n*sizeof(double));
00273 
00274   const int lwork=5*n;
00275   complex double* work = malloc(lwork*sizeof(complex double));
00276   double* rwork = malloc(lwork*sizeof(double));
00277 
00278   int info;
00279   
00280   // perform SVD of overlap matrix
00281   copycmat(n, N, U);
00282   FORTRAN(zgesvd)(&jobu, &jobvt, &n, &n, U, &n, S, 
00283                   NULL, &n, Vh, &n, work, &lwork, rwork, &info);
00284 
00285   // for zero matrices
00286   if (S[0] == 0.0) {
00287     *dim = 0;
00288     return;
00289   }
00290 
00291   // dimension of subspace
00292   int m=0;
00293 
00294   while (m<n && S[m]/S[0] > thresh)
00295     m++;
00296 
00297   // if our subspace is empty nothing to do any more
00298 
00299   if (!m) {
00300     *dim = 0;
00301     return;
00302   }
00303 
00304   // project into subspace
00305   complex double *AV = malloc(m*n*sizeof(complex double));
00306   complex double *invNA = malloc(m*m*sizeof(complex double));
00307   int k,l,i,j;
00308 
00309   for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00310     for (l=0; l<m; l++) {
00311       AV[i+l*n] = 0.0;
00312       for (j=0; j<n; j++)
00313         AV[i+l*n] += A[i+j*n]*conj(Vh[l+j*n]);
00314     }
00315         
00316   for (l=0; l<m; l++)
00317     for (k=0; k<m; k++) {
00318       invNA[k+l*m] = 0.0;
00319       for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00320         invNA[k+l*m] += 1/S[k]*conj(U[i+k*n])*AV[i+l*n];
00321       } 
00322 
00323   // solve eigenvalue problem in subspace
00324 
00325   const char jobvl='N', jobvr='V';
00326   complex double *vb = malloc(m*sizeof(complex double));
00327   complex double *Vb = malloc(m*m*sizeof(complex double));
00328 
00329   FORTRAN(zgeev)(&jobvl, &jobvr, &m, invNA, &m, vb, NULL, &m, Vb, &m,
00330                  work, &lwork, rwork, &info);
00331 
00332   // imbed solution in full space
00333 
00334   for (i=0; i<m; i++)
00335     v[i] = vb[i];
00336 
00337   for (k=0; k<m; k++)
00338     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00339       V[i+k*n] = 0.0;
00340       for (l=0; l<m; l++)
00341         V[i+k*n] += conj(Vh[l+i*n])*Vb[l+k*m];
00342     }
00343 
00344   // // normalize eigenvectors with respect to overlap matrix N
00345   //
00346   // double *norm2 = malloc(m*sizeof(double));
00347   //
00348   // for (i=0; i<m; i++) {
00349   //   norm2[i] = 0.0;
00350   //
00351   //   for (k=0; k<n; k++)
00352   //     for (l=0; l<n; l++)
00353   //       norm2[i] += conj(V[l+i*n])*N[l+k*n]*V[k+i*n];
00354   // }
00355   //
00356   // for (i=0; i<m; i++) 
00357   //   for (k=0; k<n; k++)
00358   //     V[k+i*n] /= sqrt(norm2[i]);
00359   //
00360   // free(norm2);
00361 
00362   *dim = m;
00363 
00364   free(Vb); free(vb);
00365   free(AV); free(invNA);
00366   free(work); free(rwork);
00367   free(U); free(Vh); free(S);
00368 }

00370 
00371 // sort first dim eigenstates, starting with smalles eigenvalue
00372 
00373 static int cmpmerit(void* ap, void* bp) 
00374 {
00375   double a=*(double*) ap;
00376   double b=*(double*) bp;
00377   
00378   return (a<=b ? (a<b ? 1 : 0) : -1);
00379 }
00380 
00381 void sorteigenstates(int n, complex double* v, complex double* V, int dim)
00382 {
00383   int i,k;
00384 
00385   struct merit {
00386     double val;
00387     int idx;
00388   } merits[dim];
00389 
00390   for (i=0; i<dim; i++) {
00391     merits[i].idx = i;
00392     merits[i].val = -creal(v[i]);
00393   }
00394 
00395   qsort(merits, dim, sizeof(struct merit), cmpmerit);
00396 
00397   complex double vsorted[dim];
00398   complex double Vsorted[n*dim];
00399 
00400   for (i=0; i<dim; i++) {
00401     vsorted[i] = v[merits[i].idx];
00402     for (k=0; k<n; k++) 
00403       Vsorted[k+i*n] = V[k+merits[i].idx*n];
00404   }
00405 
00406   // copy into original v and V
00407 
00408   for (i=0; i<dim; i++) {
00409     v[i] = vsorted[i];
00410     for (k=0; k<n; k++)
00411       V[k+i*n] = Vsorted[k+i*n];
00412   }
00413 }
